result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald A Pickett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain high school diploma or equivalency.  Obtain employment skills and part-time employment while attending school or training; full-time when education is completed.

Upon release to extended supervision, reside six months at a transitional sober living facility.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Submit DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Enroll in program at Racine Vocational Ministry.  Participate in the Fatherhood Initiative at the YMCA.  Follow through with recommendations.  Work toward obtaining driver's license.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety must be maintained.

Defendant Donald A Pickett in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Defendant Donald A Pickett in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue

State's offer and recommendation:  Plea to charge in 14CF490, mfg/delivery of heroin less than 3 grams; remaining charges to be dismissed and read-in (14CF1640, 14CF1613, 15CF125)
Plea questionnaire filed.  Court colloquy re elements of charges, defendant's rights  and possible penalties.  
Defendant indicates understanding.
Court finds defendant entering plea freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
PLEA - guilty
Finding of guilt.
Defendant waives psi; sentencing to proceed.  Defense counsel has provided additional information to the Court and the State.

voting prohibited, 
firearm prohibition;

not CIP eligible (aged out)

Defendant Donald A Pickett in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Defendant Donald A Pickett in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.    Transcript filed: 11-16-15 ds.

BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with any known drug users or dealers. No contact w/co-defendants. Make all court hearings. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
